msItem.title: Canon tables
Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus
msItem.incipit: አውሴብስ፡ ዘቆርጵያኖስ፡ ለዘአፈቅር፡ አኁየ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ወዳኅና፡ ለከ፡ እምኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አምኖስ፡ እንከ፡ እልክስንድራዊ፡ በብዙኅ፡ አስተሓምሞ፡ ወጽሂቅ፡ ገብረ፡ ወኀደገ፡ ለነ፡ ቃለ፡ ዘከመ፡ ኀብሩ፡ አርባዕቱ፡ ወንጌል፡ ወእምዝ፡ አርእስተ፡ ምንባባት፡ ወበእንተዝ፡

title.hi: ግጻዌ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘእንተ፡ ኅብረተ፡ ቃላት፡ ዘአርባዕቱ፡ ወንጌላት።

msItem.incipit: እንዘ፡ ይተሉ፡ ረድኤተ፡ ክልኤቱ፡ ባሕቲቶሙ፡ ጸሐፉ፡ እንከ፡ ወንጌለ፡ እምሐዋርያት፡ ወክልኤቱ፡ እመትሎሆሙ፡ አሓዱ፡ ዘጴጥሮስ፡ ወዘጴጥሮስ፡ ረድአ፡ ዚኣሁ፡ ምስለ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወማቴዎስ።

msItem.title: List of “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew, 68 titles
msItem.incipit:
፩በእንተ፡ ሰብ አ፡ ሰገል፨
፪በእንተ፡ እለ፡ ተቀትሉ፡ ሕፃናት፨
፫በእንተ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘከመ፡ ሰበከ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፨
መጽሐፈ፡ ልደቱ፡ ለኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወልደ፡ አብርሃም፡ አብርሃም፡ ወለዶ፡ ለይስሐቅ፡ ወይስሐቅኒ፡ ወለዶ፡ ለያዕቆብ፨ ወያዕቆብ ኒ፡ ወለዶ፡ ለይሁዳ፡ ወለአኃዊሁ፨

msItem.title: List of “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark, 48 titles
msItem.incipit:
፩በእንተ፡ ዘጋኔን፨
፪በእንተ፡ ሐማተ፡ ጴጥሮስ፨
፫በእንተ፡ እለ፡ ተፈወሱ፡ እምብዙኅ፡ ደዌ፨
ቀዳሚሁ፡ ለወንጌል፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚኣብሔር፡ በከመ፡ ጽሑፍ፡ ውስተ፡ ነቢያት፡ ናሁ፡ አነ፡ እፌኑ፡ መልአክየ፡ ቅድመ፡ ገጽከ፡ ዘይጸይሕ፡ ፍኖተከ። ቃለ፡ አዋዲ፡ ዘይሰብክ፡ በገዳም፡ ወይብል፡ ጽሑኣ፡ ፍኖቶ፡ ለእግዚኣብሔር፡ ወዐርዩ፡ ፍኖቶ፨

msItem.title: List of “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke, 84 titles
msItem.incipit:
፩በእንተ፡ ጸሕፍ፨
፪በእንተ፡ እለ፡ ይሔልዉ፡ ኖሎት፨
፫በእንተ፡ ስምዖን፨

msItem.title: Gospel of Luke
msItem.incipit: እስመ፡ ብዙኃን፡ እለ፡ አኀዙ፡ ወጠኑ፡ ይንግሩ፡ ይግበሩ፡ ወይሜህሩ፡ በእንተ፡ ግብር፡ ዘ አምኑ፡ በላዕሌነ፡ በከመ፡ መሀሩነ፡ እለ፡ ቀደሙነ፡ ርእዮቶ፡ ወተልእክዎ፡ በቃሉ፡ ወረትዓኒ፡ ሊተኒ፡ እትልዎ፡ እምጥንቱ፡ ወእጠይቆ፡ ለኵሉ፡ በበመትልዉ፨

msItem.title: List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John, 20 titles
msItem.incipit:
፩በእንተ፡ ከብካበ፡ ዘበቃና፨
፪በእንተ፡ ዘሰደደ፡ እምኵራብ፨
፫በእንተ፡ ኖቆዲሞስ፨

ብስራተ፡ አብ፡ ትሩፍ፡ ረድእ፡ ተናጋሪ፡ በመለኮት፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘብዴዎስ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ። በረከተ፡
ጸጋሁ፡ ወሀብተ፡ ረድኤቱ፡ ይኩን፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ክርስቶስ። ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን። ።
ቀዳሚሁ፡ ቃል፡ ውእቱ፡ ወውእቱ፡ ቃል፡ ኀበ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ውእቱ።

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation by Ethio-SPaRE, in pencil, in the outer corner of the bottom margin.
supportDesc.collation:
The original structure of quire A was different. It was probably a quaternion composed of two bifolia (the counterparts separated from each other long time ago). Leaf 1 has been pasted upon the inner side of the front board as paste-down (see below). Its counterpart, the original leaf 4 of the quire (equivalent to ) is (the misplaced) . This appears to be certain because the text body of Addition 2 left mirrored imprint on the preceeding verso-side of the former leaf 3 of the quire, (currently ); the end of the additional note is on the recto-side of leaf 1 of the next quire 1 (now ). Remarkably, the original leaf 4 () of quire A is ruled whereas the paste-down (its former counterpart) and other leaves of the quire are not. It is possible that out of four leaves only one, meant for an important and long note, was pricked and ruled. The pricks on leaf 4 (i.e. ) are slits, different from those of the reqular text leaves. The text ruled lines on the leaf are of type J while they are of type C on the other regular leaves of the volume (see below). The quire map below reflects the condition of the manuscript before the conservation work of 19 November 2011 (see below).

supportDesc.condition: The back board is split and carefully repaired; the biggest part of the leather covering is missing.

layout.note: The layout was meant for the canon tables of . All data are for .
layout.ab: The ruling pattern is different from the pattern of the regular text quires.

layout.note: The layout was meant for . All data are for .
layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written below the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: Late fourteenth-/first half of the fifteenth-century “square” script.
handNote.desc: Careful and regular; by a well-trained scribe. Broad script. Downstrokes are right-sloping, tops are very slightly inclined to the left or horizontal (cp. the letters ወ, መ, ሠ). Mostly rounded letter shapes. The the 7th-order marker of ሎ is attached to the leg of the letter without any linking line, very close to the top; the loops of መ are set closely to each other, with no space in-between. The numerals are mostly written without dashes above and below. The numeral ፮ looks like “compressed” ፯; numerals ፩ and ፬ have exactly the same shape (slightly elongated, pointed), but the first is directed upwards and the second downwards. The same scribe probably wrote Mss. MY-001 and MY-002 (see above and Appendix II).

decoNote.desc: The incipit page of each Gospel is decorated with three sets of crux ansata between two coronis-signs.
Small crude drawing of a cross in the upper margin of some folia.

item.desc: Biographical note concerning the arrival of the 17th-century monk Zabāna Krǝstos at Dabra Māʿṣo Yoḥannǝs and construction of a church by him, crudely written by Zabāna Krǝstos himself.
item.q: በእንተ፡ ፍቅሩ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ መጻእኩ፡ አነ፡ ዘባነ፡ ክርስ፡ ቶስ፡ መነኮስ፡ ሐነ፡ ፅኩዋ፡ ለቤ፡ ተክርስቲያን፡ ኢትርስዑኒ፡ አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት።
item.note: Zabāna Krǝstos lived during the time of the Coptic patriarch Matthew (IV) (in tenure 1660-1675) and the Ethiopian metropolitan Krǝstodulo (II) (in tenure in 1664-1671).

item.desc: Note on commemoration days of some individuals, with mistakes and orthographic peculiarities, written in the hand of Zabāna Krǝstos.
item.q: በእንተ፡ ዘከሮሙ፡ ለአበውየ፡ በሐለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዘሚካኤል፡ ለሀብተ፡ ሚካኤል። ተዝካሩ፡ አመ፲ወሰኑይ፡ ለሀምሌ። ወተክለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወል፡ ዱ፡ ወተስፋ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ከማሆሙ፡ ኢተርስ፡ እዎሙ። ወሐብተ፡ ኢየሱስኒ፡ ተዘከሩ፡ አመ፡ ሀሙሱ፡ ለሐምሌ።

item.desc: Record concerning the collapse of the church of John the Baptist (Dabra Maʿṣo Yoḥannǝs) and construction of another one by mamhər Walda Yoḥannəs, written crudely, in the hand of Zabāna Krǝstos.
item.q: ወደቀደ፡ ወድቀ፡ መቅደሱ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ ወሃነጸ፡ መምሕርነ፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አቡሁ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ማ

item.desc: written in the bottom margin of the folia in two columns, in the hand of the 17th-century monk Zabāna Krǝstos.
item.q:
ፍትሐት፡ ዘወልድ፡ እግዚእ፡ እግዚእ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልድ፡ ዋሕድ፡ ቃለ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ዘበተከ፡ እምኔነ፡ ኵሎ፡ ማእሰረ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፡
ተዘከሮስ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ለሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አባ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወብፁዕ፡ ጳጳስነ፡ አባ፡ ክርስቶደሉ፡
ፍትሐት። ዘወልድ። ጸሎተ። ቡራኪ። ጸሐፍኩ። ለክሙ፡ ከመ፡ ይኵነኒ፡ መርሀ፡ በመንግስተ። ሰማያት፡ ኢትርስዑኒ፡ በጊዜ፡ እጣን፡ ወቊርባን። አቡነ፡ ዘበሰማያት፡ ለመምሕርክሙ። ዘነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አንትሙ፡ ደቂቅየ፡ ክፍለ፡ ስምዖን። ወተክለ፡ ሚካኤል፡፡ ወንዋየ፡ ማርያም። ወኪዳነ፡ ምሕረት። ወትንሳኤ፡ ክርስቶስ።

item.desc: Record concerning hunger that broke out in the region, probably in the year 1664 CE, written in the hand of Zabāna Krǝstos.
item.q: በ፷፻፯፲ወ፮፡ አመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በ፫፻ወ፮፡ አመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ መጽአ፡ ርሀብ፡ ለዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡ ምድር
item.note: The Era of Mercy is used twice with different dates. If counted from the Creation of the World, the first of them, the year 6716 results in 1224 CE, unlikely to be correct. But the second date, the year 316, if counted according to the Era of the Martyrs, corresponds to 1664 CE and can indeed be the first year of Zabāna Krǝstos’ presence in the area (cp. 158, 167).

item.desc: Note on commemoration days of ʾƎndālu and his other relatives, written in a crude early hand, by Habta Māryām, a son of ʾƎndālu. The note mentions ʾƎndālu's other sons Za-Mikāʾel and Samara Krǝstos who was killed by ʾƎrəb ʾAraʿ (a person or an ethnic group?).
item.q: በአኰቴታ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አነ፡ ሀብተ፡ መርያም፡ ሐጥእ፡ ጸኀፍኩ፡ ለአቡይ። እንዳሉ፡ ወለብእሲቱ፡ ዜነ፡ መርየም፡ ተዝከሮሙ፡ ምስለ፡ ብእሲሀ፡ በአኀዱ፡ ዕለት ተዝከረ፡ ዕረፍቱ፡ እም፳ወ፬ ለመስከረም፡ ወለዘ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወልዱሂ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ለሕዳር። ዕረፍቱ። ወለሰመረ፡ ክርስቶስሂ፡ ፳ወ፩። ለጥቅምት፡ ዕረፍቱሂ፡ ወቀተልዎ፡ እርብ፡ አረዕ፡ ወበጸሎቶሙ፡ ይምሐረኒ። ለኀጥእ፡ ሀብተ፡ መርያም፡ ለዐለም፡ ዐለም፡ አሜን።

item.desc: Note exhorting to celebrate the feasts and commemoration days for God, St Mary, angels and saints, possibly a later addition to the previous note. Written crudely, in the hand of Zabāna Krǝstos.
item.q: ወዕቀቤሙ፡ በሃይማኖት፡ ርትዕት፡ ወያዕርጉ፡ ለከ፡ ስብሀት፡ ወከብር፡ በኵሉ፡ መዋዕለ፡ ሕይወ፡ ቶሙ፡

item.desc: Note commemorating Patriarch ʾAstonā “of the country of Rome” (ሮሜ፡) who resided and died at Dabra Maʿṣo, written by the scribe Yoḥannǝs in the time of King Zarʾa Yāʿqob, on the order of Za-ʾAmānuʾel (edited and translated in ). The leaf with the beginning and the bulk of the note was misplaced (; see above).
item.q:
በስመ፡ ሥሉስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አሓዱ፡ እግዚኣብሔር፡ ተጽሕፈ፡ ተዝካረ፡ ዕረፍቱ፡ ለኣባ፡ አስቶና፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘሮሜ፡ ሃገር፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ አስመርዎ፡ ለእግዚኣብሔር፡ በስነ፡ ትዕግስቶሙ፡ ወፈጸሙ፡ ስምዖሙ፡ በሰናይ፡ በደብረ፡ ማዕጾ፡
ዝክሩኒ፡ በጸሎትክሙ፡ ለሓጥእ፡
ዘአማኑኤል፡ በእንተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ፍቅሬ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርክ፡ ፍሬ፡ ምድር፡

item.desc: A supplication prayer from , in the contemporary version a part of the readings for Holy Monday ( 48a-49a, ጸልዩ፡ በእንተ፡ ጸንዐ፡ ዛቲ፡ መካን፡). Written in the hand of the scribe Yoḥannǝs.
item.q:
ወይብል፡ ካህን፡ ዘንተ፡ ስእለታት። በሳሙነ፡ ሕማማት። በኵሉ፡ ሰዐታት፡ ወያወሥኡ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ወይብሉ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ተሠሃለነ። ጸልዩ። በእንተ፡ ዛቲ፡ ጽንዐ፡ መካን፡
እለ᎓ ይትመነደቡ᎓ በቤተ᎓ ሞቅሕ᎓ ወእለ᎓ ውስተ᎓ ፄዋዌ᎓ ወእ

item.desc: Land charters of Dabra Māʿṣo Yoḥannəs (edited, translated and analysed in ), written by the second half of the 19th-century scribe Walda Muse.
item.q: ለእመ፡ ሐልቀ፡ ቀዳማዊ፡ ብራና፡ ሀሎ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ዘአጽሐፍዋ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ አምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወንጉሥነ፡ ገበረ፡ መስቀል በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ። ወአውሥኦ፡ ፱ወዉዊዋዌውዎ፡ ኍልቈ፡ ፫፻፹፸፪ፋ፡ ወበዳግምሂ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ገብረ፡ መስቀል፨ ወአምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ንጉሥ፡ ከመ፡ ይወጽእ፡ ዕክለ፡ ግብሩ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ ዕክል፡ ወላህም፡ ከመ፡ ይኵኖሙ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ነፍሶሙ፨ ወቀዳሲሃ፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ጳጳስ፡ ወዓቃቤ፡ ሰዓቱሂ፡ ፍሬ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ሊቀ፡ ዲያቆናት፡ ዘቤተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘዋሥል፡ ወሥዩም፡ ዘደብረ፡ ማዕፆ፡ ሕዝበ፡ አንበሬ፡ ወንጉሥ፡ አምደ፡ ጽዮን፡

item.desc: Document concerning land possession (rəst), in Tǝgrǝñña with admixture of Amharic, in part hardly understandable.
item.q: የርስት፡ ነገር፡ ሕንፃትን፡ ዘወልድን፡ አህዋት፡ ሕንፃት፡ ወልደ፡ ሚካዔል፡ ወልደ፡ ወልደሚካዔል፡ የርስት፡ ነገር፡ ሕንፃትን፡ ዘወልድን፡ አህዋት፡ ሕንፃት፡ ወልደ፡ ሚካዔል፡ ወለደ፡ ወልደሚካዔል፡ ለተስፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ወለድኩካ፡ ርስት፡ ብላዕ፡ ስተ፡ በሎ፡ አእጥነኒ፡ አተስክረኒ፡ በሎ፡ ክሳዕ፡ ወዶም፡ መምሕረይ፡ ዕቍባ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ጸንኸ፡ እናዕጠኑ፡ እናተስከሩ። ደጃች፡ ገብረ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ፫አመት፡ ደጃች፡ ስባጋዲስ፡ ፱አመት፡ ደጃች፡ ውቤ፡ ፳ወ፬አመት፡ ናይቴዎድሮስ፡ ፲ወ፫አመት፡ ይ፡ ናይ፡ ሐፀይ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ፳ወ፫አመት፡ ናይንጉሥ፡ ምንሊክ፡ ፲ወ፬አመት፡ ርስት፡ ቀሳለጎ፡ ናይ፡ ወዲወልታኖ፡ እኖዑ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወልደሚካኤል፡ ንተስፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ሀቦ፡ ርስት፡ ከይህብ፡ በደጃዝማች፡ ሀጎስ፡ ተማጉተይ፡ ነአአ፡ ከይህብ፡ ፴፬አደኩ፡ መወዳዕታዑ፡ ብንጉሥ፡ አይትበሉ፡ ትመሀሉ፡ ቢሎም፡ ለቀቁ፡ ውሉድ፡ እዩ፡ በለ፡ መውእል፡ ቍጸር፡ ተፈጸም፡ በልዎ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ይሙቱ፡ ሀጎስ፡ ይሙት፡ ውሉድ፡ ኢዮም፡ የእጥኑ፡ የተስክሩ፡ ከምጥንቶም፡ በጊዕ፡ ፫ተ፡ ከብቲ፡ ፪አብአ፡ አይተ፡ ወልደሚካዔልን፡ አብድቆምን፡ እተሐርዳ።

item.desc: Ownership note, very crudely written, partly ununderstandable.

Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts and occassions, in several crude hands, written mostly in frames, in the upper margins of some folia. ተወሊደ on (in the hand of Zabāna Krǝstos), ዘጥምቀት on , ዘጻድቃን on , ጉባኤ፡ ሐዋርያት on , ዘዮሐንስ፡ መስከረም on , ዘሰንበት on , በቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል on , ዘምትረተ፡ ርዕሱ፡ ለዮሐንስ on , ሰንበት on , ዘደናግል on , በሚካኤል on , ፀቤሖ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወሣልስት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በ፯ሰዓት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በ፱ሰዓት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወእሑድ፡ ሰንበት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ዘጥምቀት on , ዘሰንበት on , ዘደብረ፡ ዘይት on , ወመሲተ፡ ከዊኖ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወሶበ፡ በጽሐ። on , በሰለስቱ። on , በስድስቱ። on , በጊዜ፡ ተሱዓተ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወእሑድ፡ ሰንበት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ዘኪዳነ፡ ምህረት on , ወምሲተ፡ ከዊኖ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወጸቢሐ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በሰልስት on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በቅትር ምንባብ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በተ፱ሰዓት on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወእሑድ፡ ሰንበት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በኒቆዲሞስ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በአግብኦተ᎓ ግብር። on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወመሲዮ፡ በእለተ᎓ ሐሙስ᎓ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ወፀቤሐ፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), በ፫ሰዓት፡ on (by Zabāna Krǝstos), ዘመድሐኔ አለም on , በ፯ሰዓት on (this and the following notes are in the hand of Zabāna Krǝstos), በ፱ሰዓት on , በ፲፬ሰዓት on , በእሑድ፡ ሰንበት፡ on , በ፲ወ፬ on .
The name of Zabāna Krǝstos written interlineally, in his own hand.
A few crude pen trials, doodles in red, lines, red stains on some folia.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards which were covered with reddish-brown leather, now for the most part missing with the exception of the turn-ins (of the “overlapping” type (cp. 231 and fig. 9.38f). The leather is decorated with crude, fait straight tooled lines. Small holes are visible in the overlapping corners of the turn-ins. The parchment leaf glued onto the inner side of the front board, under the turn-ins, could be a pastedown that used to reinforce the connection between the textblock and the binding. Two pairs of sewing stations. Solid, thick and shiny threads of the original sewing, of animal origin, are still partly in place. Endbands are missing, the threads of the endband sewing (also of animal origin) are partly preserved on the spine.
Leaf string markers (coloured threads or small strips of textile) are inserted in the upper outer corner (mostly in the upper text prick) of some leaves, .

history.origin: Late fourteenth/early fifteenth century, probably 1382-1412 The manuscript may have been copied by the same scribe as Mss MY-002 and MY-001, and donated together with them by Tasabka Madḫən, in the time of King Dāwit II (r. ca. 1382—1412).
history.acquisition: The manuscript was later used as “Golden Gospel” of the church. Several additional notes were penned by Zabāna Krǝstos.

custodialHist.custEvent: During the conservation measures carried out on 19 November 2011 two misplaced leaves of the manuscripts were returned to their original places, was accomodated between and (see above), and between and .

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
